problem.markdown:
>>Single-stage models are models<< ( ) That have one queue.
( ) That have one server.
(x) For which a client can only be served by one server before leaving the system. [explanation] After being served by one server, clients in multi-stage models may be served by other servers or other processes. In single-stage models, the client only undergoes one process--being served by a server in the system--and must leave afterwards. The M/M/1 queue and M/M/s queue are both examples of single-stage models. [explanation]
